name: fleet-coder
description: This extension allows you to copy code to multiple machines at the same time

fleet-coder.IPs.description: Path of the csv (newline seprated) with the IPs of the machines to sync code to.

fleet-coder.username.description: The username of remote machines to use for SSH connections.

fleet-coder.password.description: The password of remote machines to use for SSH connections.

fleet-coder.buildCommand.description: The command to build the code.

fleet-coder.rosVersionName.description: Name of the ROS version to source ros before building.

fleet-coder.workspacePath.description: Path of your workspace on the remote machines. By default the workspace will be assumed to be in the home folder (/username/home/).

fleet-coder.sourceCommands.description: List of shell source commands to run before executing ROS-related commands. They will be executed in order.

fleet-coder.sourceAfterBuild.description: Path to source your new build after calling the build command.

fleet-coder.launchFileName.description: Name of the launch file to execute. The file should be in the launch folder (.py, .yaml or .xml).

fleet-coder.packageName.description: Name of the package you want to launch. This lets you define the package for the launch file

fleet-coder.excludedFolders.description: List of folders to exclude when syncing the workspace.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
